review.body: Quick walkthrough. Pretty simple stuff, just many copies of it.

pull_request.title: Initial WeatherManager refactor
pull_request.body:
This looks like a huge change, but it really isn't. The number of lines changed is inflated 3 to 4X by two syntactic changes:

- Renaming the `UtilityRoutines` namespace to `Util`.
- Renaming the `dataWeatherManager` state object to `dataWeather`. As I go through some of these things I am removing the word `Manager` (and some other words too) from module names because it adds nothing. 

The primary structural are a conversion of a whole bunch of multi-dimensional arrays of scalars to a much smaller number of multi-dimensional arrays of structures. A potential follow-on clean-up pass is to use these structures more intelligently, e.g., as parameters to routines, and to reduce structure copies.

labels.name: DoNotPublish
labels.description: Includes changes that shouldn't be reported in the changelog

labels.name: Refactoring
labels.description: Includes code changes that don't change the functionality of the program, just perform refactoring

repo.description: EnergyPlus™ is a whole building energy simulation program that engineers, architects, and researchers use to model both energy consumption and water use in buildings.

pull_request.title: Initial WeatherManager refactor
pull_request.body:
This looks like a huge change, but it really isn't. The number of lines changed is inflated 3 to 4X by two syntactic changes:

- Renaming the `UtilityRoutines` namespace to `Util`.
- Renaming the `dataWeatherManager` state object to `dataWeather`. As I go through some of these things I am removing the word `Manager` (and some other words too) from module names because it adds nothing. 

The primary structural are a conversion of a whole bunch of multi-dimensional arrays of scalars to a much smaller number of multi-dimensional arrays of structures. A potential follow-on clean-up pass is to use these structures more intelligently, e.g., as parameters to routines, and to reduce structure copies.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -4507,14 +4057,13 @@ namespace WeatherManager {
                                       Real64 const EqOfTime,     // Equation of Time
                                       Real64 const SinSolDeclin, // Sine of Solar Declination
                                       Real64 const CosSolDeclin, // Cosine of Solar Declination
-                                      Array1D<Real64> &SUNCOS)
+                                      Vector3<Real64> &SUNCOS)
comment.body: `{x,y,z}` coordinates should be `Vector3` (which is a struct) not `Array1D` (which is a heap vector).

comment.body: This idiom where we pass a bunch of strings to a function (not to mention call the function to begin with) for the rare case of errors has to stop.

repo.description: EnergyPlus™ is a whole building energy simulation program that engineers, architects, and researchers use to model both energy consumption and water use in buildings.

repo.name: EnergyPlus
repo.description: EnergyPlus™ is a whole building energy simulation program that engineers, architects, and researchers use to model both energy consumption and water use in buildings.

pull_request.title: Initial WeatherManager refactor
pull_request.body:
This looks like a huge change, but it really isn't. The number of lines changed is inflated 3 to 4X by two syntactic changes:

- Renaming the `UtilityRoutines` namespace to `Util`.
- Renaming the `dataWeatherManager` state object to `dataWeather`. As I go through some of these things I am removing the word `Manager` (and some other words too) from module names because it adds nothing. 

The primary structural are a conversion of a whole bunch of multi-dimensional arrays of scalars to a much smaller number of multi-dimensional arrays of structures. A potential follow-on clean-up pass is to use these structures more intelligently, e.g., as parameters to routines, and to reduce structure copies.
